answers.answer: Romanian and English language courses are available for Ukrainian refugees in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Language courses and activities for Ukrainian refugees'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian refugees can access various activities through organizations such as IOM, Centrul de Tineret FNT, JRS Romania, and the Ukrainian Educational Center.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Language courses and activities for Ukrainian refugees'.

answers.answer: The International Organization for Migration (IOM) offers Romanian language courses for adults.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Romanian courses for adults from IOM'.

answers.answer: Individuals can register for IOM Romanian language courses at one of their offices in Bucharest, located at Viitorului Street, no 11, Sector 2 or Constantin Daniel Street, no 5, Sector 1.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Romanian courses for adults from IOM'.

answers.answer: The IOM offices are open for registration from Monday to Friday, from 9:00 to 17:00.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Romanian courses for adults from IOM'.

answers.answer: Centrul de Tineret FNT provides Romanian and English language courses, art therapy, music lessons, yoga and stretching, and history classes for refugees.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Courses and activities from Centrul de Tineret FNT'.

answers.answer: Individuals can sign up for Centrul de Tineret FNT classes on their official Facebook page or by calling +380639798162 (Telegram) or +40755567482.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Courses and activities from Centrul de Tineret FNT'.

answers.answer: JRS Romania organizes Romanian language courses, chess, drawing classes, and offers social and legal consultations for refugees.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Courses and activities for adults from JRS Romania'.

answers.answer: One can find out the schedule for JRS Romania's classes in their city by checking their Facebook group.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Courses and activities for adults from JRS Romania'.

answers.answer: The Ukrainian Educational Center offers educational, developmental, creative, and sports activities, as well as psychological support for children from Ukraine.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Ukrainian Educational Center from the Romanian-Finnish Highschool'.

answers.answer: Children from families in or near Bucharest with temporary protection status are allowed to enroll. To inquire about enrollment, one can contact Olga Gireada at +40 726 646 733.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Ukrainian Educational Center from the Romanian-Finnish Highschool'.

answers.answer: Resources available for independent Romanian learning include a Romanian Phrase Book, the 'Romanian Language for Ukrainians' manual from UNHCR Romania, and handbooks for teenagers and children by Terre des hommes.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The 'Heroes Cry Too' coloring book for children can be accessed by downloading it from the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Coloring book for children "Heroes cry too"'.

answers.answer: Individuals can watch the Romanian video language course from TVR1 on YouTube.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Romanian video language course from TVR1'.

answers.answer: The 'Romanian Language for Ukrainians' manual from UNHCR Romania is intended for those who wish to learn the Romanian language either independently or with a teacher.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Manual "Romanian language for Ukrainians" UNHCR Romania'.
